main event: A shiny object with a dome-shaped underside was observed in the sky, flashing as it disappeared to the south at an elevation of 1,000 yards.
interesting points: The object exhibited horizontal flight at high speed.
The sighting was considered a 'probable major sighting report' but deemed an 'unreliable report'.
The witness estimated the object was 1,000 feet away and visible for 20 seconds.
The witness was a 19-year-old male student with no special educational training.
Other witnesses, including the witness's sister and cousin, also reported seeing the bright, strange object in the sky.
location: Between New Martinsville and Wheeling, West Virginia
witnesses: a 19-year-old male student and his sister and cousin
